column1: Fibrates are medicines prescribed to help lower high triglyceride levels.
Triglycerides are a type of fat in your blood.
Fibrates also may help raise your HDL (good) cholesterol.
High triglycerides along with low HDL cholesterol increase the risk of heart disease and stroke.
Statins are thought to be the best drugs to use for people who need medicines to lower their cholesterol.
However, some studies show that using certain fibrates along with statins may not help reduce the risk of heart attack or stroke more than using statins alone.
Fibrates may also be used to help lower high triglycerides in people at risk for pancreatitis.
Certain medicines may interact with fibrates.
Regular blood tests will help you and your provider: - See how well the medicine is working - Monitor for side effects, such as liver problems
